instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status), demographic_section_capi(capi_fk, sub_caste, gender, age, caste_category, caste_original, sc_sub_caste, obc_sub_caste, gen_sub_caste, st_sub_caste, job_type, religion, mobile, highest_qualification)

Display job type distribution by gender (Other) in Haryana for HR_2021 round 3?
output: SELECT d.gender, d.job_type, COUNT(*) FROM demographic_section_capi d JOIN capi_fact cf ON d.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE d.gender = 'Other' AND  sdd.state_abb = 'HR' AND sdd.election_cycle = 'HR_2021' AND sdd.election_round = '3' GROUP BY d.gender, d.job_type;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status), reason_to_vote_capi(reason_to_vote, capi_fk)

What were the most common reasons to vote in Jharkhand?
output: SELECT reason_to_vote, COUNT(*) FROM reason_to_vote_capi rtv JOIN capi_fact cf ON rtv.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE sdd.state_abb = 'JH' GROUP BY reason_to_vote ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 5;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: ae_section_capi(capi_fk, cand_pref_ques, cm_preference, cm_work_satisfaction, past_vote_pref, future_vote_pref, mla_work_satisfaction, ac_issues, ac_winner_preference, state_winner_preference, state_schemes_benefitted), capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status)

Which party has the highest future vote preference in Karnataka in round KA_2022 of 2.1?
output: SELECT asc2.future_vote_pref, COUNT(*) FROM ae_section_capi asc2 JOIN capi_fact cf ON asc2.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE sdd.state_abb = 'KA' AND sdd.election_round = 'KA_2022' AND sdd.election_cycle = '2.1' GROUP BY asc2.future_vote_pref ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status), reason_to_vote_capi(reason_to_vote, capi_fk)

What were the most common reasons to vote in Bihar?
output: SELECT reason_to_vote, COUNT(*) FROM reason_to_vote_capi rtv JOIN capi_fact cf ON rtv.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE sdd.state_abb = 'BR' GROUP BY reason_to_vote ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 5;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: ae_section_capi(capi_fk, cand_pref_ques, cm_preference, cm_work_satisfaction, past_vote_pref, future_vote_pref, mla_work_satisfaction, ac_issues, ac_winner_preference, state_winner_preference, state_schemes_benefitted), capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status)

Provide count of responses by CM satisfaction in Ladakh for LA_2022 round 3?
output: SELECT ae.cm_work_satisfaction, COUNT(*) FROM ae_section_capi ae JOIN capi_fact cf ON ae.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE sdd.state_abb = 'LA' AND sdd.election_cycle = 'LA_2022' AND sdd.election_round = '3' GROUP BY ae.cm_work_satisfaction;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status), demographic_section_capi(capi_fk, sub_caste, gender, age, caste_category, caste_original, sc_sub_caste, obc_sub_caste, gen_sub_caste, st_sub_caste, job_type, religion, mobile, highest_qualification)

Show respondent count by age group (60+) in Kerala for KL_2023 round 1?
output: SELECT d.age, COUNT(*) FROM demographic_section_capi d JOIN capi_fact cf ON d.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE d.age = '60+' AND  sdd.state_abb = 'KL' AND sdd.election_cycle = 'KL_2023' AND sdd.election_round = '1' GROUP BY d.age ORDER BY d.age;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: caste_data(cons_name, cr_cons_id, cd_id, caste, sub_caste, caste_perc, category, cr_state)

Which caste groups dominate in Maharashtra?
output: SELECT caste, SUM(caste_perc) FROM caste_data WHERE cr_state = 'MH' GROUP BY caste ORDER BY SUM(caste_perc) DESC LIMIT 5;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: ae_section_capi(capi_fk, cand_pref_ques, cm_preference, cm_work_satisfaction, past_vote_pref, future_vote_pref, mla_work_satisfaction, ac_issues, ac_winner_preference, state_winner_preference, state_schemes_benefitted), capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status)

Which party has the highest future vote preference in Nagaland in round NL_2019 of 1?
output: SELECT asc2.future_vote_pref, COUNT(*) FROM ae_section_capi asc2 JOIN capi_fact cf ON asc2.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE sdd.state_abb = 'NL' AND sdd.election_round = 'NL_2019' AND sdd.election_cycle = '1' GROUP BY asc2.future_vote_pref ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC LIMIT 1;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status), demographic_section_capi(capi_fk, sub_caste, gender, age, caste_category, caste_original, sc_sub_caste, obc_sub_caste, gen_sub_caste, st_sub_caste, job_type, religion, mobile, highest_qualification)

Give job type distribution by gender (Male) in Odisha for OR_2020_AE round 3?
output: SELECT d.gender, d.job_type, COUNT(*) FROM demographic_section_capi d JOIN capi_fact cf ON d.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE d.gender = 'Male' AND  sdd.state_abb = 'OR' AND sdd.election_cycle = 'OR_2020_AE' AND sdd.election_round = '3' GROUP BY d.gender, d.job_type;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: caste_data(cons_name, cr_cons_id, cd_id, caste, sub_caste, caste_perc, category, cr_state)

Which caste groups dominate in Sikkim?
output: SELECT caste, SUM(caste_perc) FROM caste_data WHERE cr_state = 'SK' GROUP BY caste ORDER BY SUM(caste_perc) DESC LIMIT 5;

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), normalisation_ac_table_capi(capi_fk, raw, vn, vn_final, vn_ae, vn_agc, vn_agc_ae, vn_gc, vn_gc_ae, vn_c, vn_c_ae, vn_ge, vn_ae_ge, vn_raw_ae, vn_average, vn_average_ge, last_normalised_ae, last_normalised_ge, caste, vn_raw_ge), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status)

Provide average normalised score (vn) in Rajasthan for RJ_2019_AE round 2.2.
output: SELECT ROUND(AVG(n.vn)::numeric, 2) FROM normalisation_ac_table_capi n JOIN capi_fact cf ON n.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE sdd.state_abb = 'RJ' AND sdd.election_cycle = 'RJ_2019_AE' AND sdd.election_round = '2.2';

instruction:
Given the following schema:
Tables: capi_fact(capi_pk, mongo_doc_id, respondent_unique_id, sd_dm_fk, doc_exists), survey_desc_dimension_capi(sd_dm_pk, state_abb, election_cycle, election_round, level, cons_no, status, reporting_round, ac_mapping_fk, audit_status, normalisation, recalibration_status), demographic_section_capi(capi_fk, sub_caste, gender, age, caste_category, caste_original, sc_sub_caste, obc_sub_caste, gen_sub_caste, st_sub_caste, job_type, religion, mobile, highest_qualification)

Provide respondent count by age group (60+) in West Bengal for WB_2020_AE round 1.1?
output: SELECT d.age, COUNT(*) FROM demographic_section_capi d JOIN capi_fact cf ON d.capi_fk = cf.capi_pk JOIN survey_desc_dimension_capi sdd ON cf.sd_dm_fk = sdd.sd_dm_pk WHERE d.age = '60+' AND  sdd.state_abb = 'WB' AND sdd.election_cycle = 'WB_2020_AE' AND sdd.election_round = '1.1' GROUP BY d.age ORDER BY d.age;
